title: 112_hr3460
content: The "American Jobs First Act of 2011" is the short title of this Act. It includes an extension and modification of dividends received deduction for certain repatriated foreign earnings. The American Jobs First Act of 2011 includes a temporary extension and modification of the dividends received deduction for repatriated foreign earnings. This amendment changes the applicable percentage to 29 percent, plus additional percentage points determined for the taxpayer. The American Jobs First Act of 2011 modifies the dividends received deduction for repatriated foreign earnings, increasing the applicable percentage to 29 percent with additional percentage points for taxpayers based on payroll expansion. The American Jobs First Act of 2011 increases the dividends received deduction for repatriated foreign earnings to 29 percent, with additional points based on payroll expansion. Qualified payroll refers to wages paid to employees, not exceeding the contribution and benefit base under the Social Security Act. The American Jobs First Act of 2011 increases the dividends received deduction for repatriated foreign earnings to 29 percent, with additional points based on payroll expansion. Remuneration subject to tax is modified by substituting 'all compensation' for 'all wages'. Special rules apply for converted employees. The American Jobs First Act of 2011 modifies remuneration subject to tax by substituting 'all compensation' for 'all wages'. Special rules apply for individuals treated as not employees for employment taxes. The American Jobs First Act of 2011 modifies remuneration subject to tax by substituting 'all compensation' for 'all wages'. Special rules apply for individuals treated as not employees for employment taxes. The taxpayer's qualified payroll for specific quarters must exceed the qualified payroll for following years. Controlled groups are treated as a single employer for this purpose. Conforming amendments are made to section 965 of the Code. Section 965 of the American Jobs First Act of 2011 is amended to change dates from June 30, 2003 to June 30, 2010 and from October 3, 2004 to October 1, 2011. The amendment applies to taxable years ending on or after the enactment date of the Act.
